title: Mathematical Inquiry Projects Through Wiki-Based Collaborative Learning (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience with Online Collaboration Tools
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric, technology-constrained environment, this program operates with a focus on formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can document a mathematical inquiry process in three or more stages using a wiki platform.
Learners can improve wiki content by reflecting on peer feedback five or more times in a collaborative learning environment.

Over 1–6 months, learners develop ≥1 mathematical model (linear regression, optimization models, etc.) applicable to real-world cases (e.g., school meal optimization, traffic flow analysis) through inquiry-based problem-solving (problem definition → data collection → model design → validation), achieving ≥'B' (80–89 points) in ≥2 of 3 teacher evaluation rubric items (problem suitability, model accuracy, practicality).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
